profile_positions.company: Atria kennisinstituut voor emancipatie en vrouwengeschiedenis
profile_positions.description:
Atria is one of the leading institutes on gender equality and women’s history, promoting gender equality by dissemination of knowledge and information, through consultancy and by stimulating the social and political debate. 

Tasks:
•	Co-responsible for Atria’s qualitative and quantitative research and the external presentation thereof
•	Policy analysis and writing of policy briefs, blogs and articles
•	Co-responsible for the coordination of Dutch civil society input (i.a. formulation of recommendations, analysis of previous sessions and organisation of side events with the Dutch governmental delegation) for the annual UN Commission on the Status of Women, in the Netherlands and on the ground in New York City.
•	Member of the Advisory Appointment Committee for the selection of the Netherlands UN Women's Representative.
•	FRA Gender Expert for the Netherlands: preparation of reports on misogyny, gender stereotyping and hate speech against women in the Netherlands as part of the contribution of the EU's Fundamental Rights Agency (FRA) to the European Commission’s 2017 Annual Colloquium on Fundamental Rights.
•      EU Gender Expert for the Netherlands: preparation of semi-annual reports on the status quo of gender equality in the Netherlands and monthly updates on policy changes, for the use of the European Commission Directorate-General for Justice and Consumers, Unit D2 'Equality between Men and Women.' Project managed by Fondazione Giacomo Brodolini (Rome, Italy).
•	Organisation of JoiEU-debate: JoiEU is part of the EU’s ‘Europe for Citizens’ programme aimed atincreasing citizen participation in the democratic life of the EU. Atria – as one of JoiEU’s partners – was responsible for hosting one debate in a series of international discussions, with a live Google Hangout connection with civil organisations in 5 different EU Member States.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer

profile_positions.company: Atria kennisinstituut voor emancipatie en vrouwengeschiedenis
profile_positions.description:
Atria is one of the leading institutes on gender equality and women’s history, promoting gender equality by dissemination of knowledge and information, through consultancy and by stimulating the social and political debate. 

Tasks:
•	For the Public Services department, I was co-responsible for the organisation of two EU-related events, one concerning the upcoming European elections and one in cooperation with JoiEU, a project that is part of the EU’s ‘Europe for Citizens’ programme, which aims at increasing citizen participation in the democratic life of the EU and strengthening the base for deeper European integration. Atria - as one of JoiEU’s partners - is in charge of hosting one debate in a series of international discussions, featuring a live connection with 11 different EU Member States. Additional Atria events that I have been involved in include the Amsterdam Museumnacht (Night at the Museum), organising lectures on WWI. 
•	Other tasks focussed on the Research and Consultancy branch of Atria and include organising expert meetings (i.a. on employment among migrant women), archival research and writing blogs and policy briefs.
profile_positions.title: Intern Public Services and Research

profile_positions.description:
DG DEVCO/Unit 01 - General Coordination and Inter-Institutional Relations

DG DEVCO is in charge of development cooperation policy in a wider framework of international cooperation, adapting to the evolving needs of partner countries. This encompasses cooperation with developing countries at different stages of development, including with countries graduated from bilateral development assistance to cover the specific needs of these countries during the transition period between low income countries and upper middle income countries. DG DEVCO works closely with other Commission services responsible for thematic policies, as well as with the European External Action Service and Commission services on external action, so as to facilitate and help ensure a consistent approach.

Tasks: 
•	Contribute to the mission of DEVCO/01 and to achieving the objectives set by the Director-General. 
•	Participate in meetings of the relevant Council Working Parties (e.g. CODEV) as well as the European Parliament Committees within the remit of Unit 01 (DEVE, AFET, DROI, and SEDE) and assist with associated preparation, coordination, briefing and reporting tasks. 
•	Participate in the preparation and organisation of possible Informal meeting(s) of EU Directors  General. Contribute to the follow-up of these meetings. 
•	Assist in ensuring that the GRI process runs smoothly for the files with DEVCO as lead or associated DG.
•       Contribute to the organisation of the Cooperation Days 2019.


Courses:
•	Human Rights and Democratisation in EU External Relations (EEAS HQ, Brussels)
The European Parliament and the New External Financing Instruments (EP, Brussels)
•	Study Mission to Rwanda
profile_positions.title: Blue Book Trainee Directorate General for International Cooperation and Development (DG DEVCO)

profile_positions.description:
The Council of Europe (CoE) is the continent’s leading human rights organisation. The mandate of DER is to assist and advise the Secretary General and the Organisation’s statutory organs, other bodies and Secretariat departments on specific political matters affecting the Council’s external relations, to promote partnerships, to increase efficiency and enhance CoE profile, avoid duplication and streamline co-operation.

Tasks:
•	Acquisition of knowledge of the Council of Europe´s working methods, following and participating in meetings of the Committee of Ministers’ Deputies and its working groups (in particular those on external relations - GR-EXT and on democracy - GR-DEM), the Parliamentary Assembly and the Congress of Regional and Local Authorities, the European Court of Human Rights and the European Parliament (EU).
•	Drafting detailed reports for the Council of Europe Liaison Offices in Brussels, Geneva, Vienna and Warsaw on the sessions of the Parliamentary Assembly and meetings of the Committee of Ministers´ Deputies and its working parties. 
•	Following and analysing relations between the Council of Europe and Observer States; other non-Member States, including states covered by the Council of Europe Policy towards the neighbouring regions, and other international organisations - with a focus on the European Union and the United Nations.
•	Preparing of briefs and analytical documents concerning these relations in Council of Europe related matters for the Secretary General, the Deputy Secretary General and the Committee of Ministers.
profile_positions.title: Trainee Directorate of External Relations (DER)

profile_positions.description:
Stayokay Amsterdam Zeeburg is a hostel and conference centre, and Stayokay’s largest branch (out of 26 locations in the Netherlands) with over 500 beds, 6 meeting rooms and a café-restaurant.

Tasks:
•	Checking in and checking out of guests, placement of reservations in Project Management System (PMS)
•	Hosting conferences and other events 
•	Invoice processing, maintenance of hotel administration, inventory and orders 
•	Communication with head office and other Stayokay subsidiaries 
•	Providing information in various languages concerning room availability, Stayokay products and services, venue rental, public transport and tourist possibilities
profile_positions.title: Staff Member Front Office

profile_positions.description:
BHRM is an independent consultancy desk specialising in strategic reputation research. The Hofkes method is unique in placing the main focus on the ability of an organisation to connect to the outside world. NieuwBestuur is a platform launched with the aim to disseminate this method, by hosting workshops, meetings and conferences for administrators and directors from various business sectors.

Tasks:
•	Execution of reputation research for a health care institution: interviewing representatives of all stakeholder groups – telephonically and on location – and digitally processing the results 
•	Organisation of a national conference on the role of reputation in administrative innovation 
.
profile_positions.title: Executor Reputation Research

profile_positions.company: Sultans Trail - a European Cultural Route
profile_positions.description:
The Sultan’s Trail Foundation is an NGO established to develop a thematic European cultural route, a hiking path running from Istanbul to Vienna, thereby following the footsteps of Ottoman sultan Suleiman the Magnificent. The aim is to boost the development of sustainable and trans-national tourism in South-Eastern Europe. The trail has gained renewed relevance as an important link between East and West, in the light of the EU’s recent and future Eastward expansion. It directly connects Member States with candidate states, building on ages of cross-fertilisation and a shared cultural heritage.

Tasks:
•	Coordination of an international academic conference in Novi Sad (Serbia) and Osijek (Croatia) on the historical, socio-economic and cultural significance of the Sultan’s Trail 
•	Contact with the European Commission’s DG Enterprise and Industry and the Council of of Europe’s Cultural Routes programme
profile_positions.title: Consultant / Coordinator International Conference

profile_positions.description:

Writing of texts on a wide variety of topics, ordered by companies
profile_positions.title: Author

volunteer_experiences.description: My voluntary work for VluchtenlingenWerk Nederland mainly focuses on assisting refugees and migrants in the Amsterdam region in their pursuit to improve their Dutch language skills, in a private, one-on-one,  informal setting. As a linguistic coach,  I act not only as a language teacher, but also as a guide in the newcomer’s novel environment, helping them to get familiar with Dutch culture and customs, and to get accustomed to life in Dutch society.
